title: Jurgen Klopp surprised that Wales boss Chris Coleman didn't call him before calling up Ben Woodburn
text:
Jurgen Klopp surprised that Wales boss Chris Coleman didn't call him before calling up Ben Woodburn The Liverpool teenager was a shock inclusion for Coleman's 23-man squad Share Woodburn is in the Wales squad (Photo: Liverpool Echo)   Thank you for subscribing!   
Jurgen Klopp has admitted his “surprise” that Chris Coleman didn’t call him first before calling up Ben Woodburn to the senior Wales squad. 
The Liverpool teenager was a shock inclusion for the 23 man squad Coleman selected to face Ireland in a World Cup qualifier on Friday. 
Reds boss Klopp insisted he wasn’t about to criticise Coleman, but openly questioned whether it was normal for a national team coach to ignore club managers before selecting players of such a tender age for their country. 
The German seemed to imply that in the Bundesliga it is standard practice to approach the club boss first to get full information on the youngster, and he said: “Actually, I was surprised about this. I don’t know exactly how it’s normal here. Woodburn has made his Reds first-team bow this season (Photo: John Powell) 
“This should not be a criticism. But usually when you call up a player, a 17-year-old player, I thought it would be possible to call me. 
“I’m not sure if he (Coleman) knows him (Woodburn) well. He didn’t play in the team so far for Coleman I think.” 
Asked if he thought, because Woodburn is just 17, it would be better for Coleman to have made contact with Liverpool before calling him into the full squad, Klopp replied: “Yeah. But no call.” 
The exciting young winger has made just seven appearances in all competitions for Liverpool, and just three starts in total, since he was elevated to the first team squad by Klopp. Coleman's side face Ireland on Friday (Photo: REUTERS) 
In fact, he is still to make a start in the Premier League, and has played only 37 minutes in total as a substitute in that competition, but Coleman is adamant he deserves his call up into the full Wales squad. 
For Klopp, the player requires much longer to learn the tricks of the trade before he is ready for senior responsibility, but he insisted Woodburn will not be fazed by his international call up. 
Asked if the 17 year old needed more time to learn before his call up, Klopp replied: “If Ben stopped learning now, that would make no sense at 17. I’m not in doubt about this. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
